Message.Title: Some limited critical thinking wrt Amazon distribution in USA Today
Message.Msg: Changes in performance are functions of changes in relative competitiveness. The competitive set of the future isn't B&N and Borders. Even Best Buy is finally thinking a little more strategically. wwwDOTusatodayDOTcom/story/tech/2013/09/28/retailers-ship-from-store/2862405/ Amazon and its investors would learn a very hard lesson in path dependence were UPS/FedEx to raise rates on it to parity with smaller retailers. It could not build out its same day delivery network fast enough for holiday season and would be in a world of hurt (especially given all the cash its burned through moving closer to cities to limit increases in shipping cost, yet still not close/convenient to customer). Amazon could shift its business to USPS and help subsidize it instead of US taxpayers... They should cease to enable Amazon's BS. The reality is that UPS/FedEx are the "efficiency" in Amazon's model, not Amazon's warehouses/distribution reach, where it is playing catch-up to WMT, TGT and others.

Planners see that urban futures will have neighborhood centers to obtain goods, not individual deliveries that HAVE to be more expensive.

Topic.Title: Shop By Local: Find national brands, locally, with the worlds most relevant local search engine, Krillion

Message.Msg: Financial Analysis & Assumptions of Local Corp - 2Q2013 Results & Recent Financial Highlights (from Covering throug Merriman Capital) . Local Corp. issued results for its recently completed 2Q2013 on the 8th of August. The company also hosted a conference call during which it discussed progress in its operating model and prospects going forward for the company. The company generated $1.2 million in positive adjusted EBITDA for the quarter. Local posted an adjusted EBITDA of only $462,000 during the same quarter a year ago and $685,000 in adjusted EBITDA last quarter. Substantial growth within the company's high-margin Network business provided Local with the substantial boost in cash flows. Most importantly, management increased its guidance for its current fiscal year, 2013. Revenues are now expected to come in at $95-$97 million and the company is expecting to generate an adjusted EBITDA of at least $5.4 million for the year, which is up from a revenue range of $93-95 million and an adjusted EBITDA of $5 million.

Topic.Title: Some limited critical thinking wrt Amazon distribution in USA Today

Message.Msg: Scamazon has no pricing advantage over BBY and TGT because both will pricematch Scamazon's prices. The more populous states are collecting sale taxes from Scamazon. But Ebay's customers still enjoy tax-fee shopping. Ebay is usually the lowest price leader when it comes to small purchases that are less than $300.

Topic.Title: complete nonsense from you again Sybil: you give reasons why short will be killed as Fed continuing printing

Message.Msg: Thanks Tail. About to read Faber's latest via ZeroHedge, but the lead in suggests he's seeing EXACTLY what I am. The entire financial sector is the bubble. It creates very little value these days (because it is all trading of liquid assets rather than investing in productive ones), yet captures quite a lot. It should have shrunk several times before this, but WS managed to shift (because regulators/DOJ/politicians failed to do the right thing) the pain elsewhere via bailout and QE (which is simply giving the banks the money first, where they benefit from the Cantillon effect) to the middle and lower classes and the elderly (no return on savings). The financial sector has become too large to continue its parasitic ways (capturing vastly more than it creates) without killing the host (stable society). Gee, NAS, Nem and all of them can talk all the smack they want. There's only 1 path out of this and that involves a realignment of value to that which is actually productive. Doesn't matter whether it happens through deflation or inflation. The future belongs to those who create it, not to those trying to inhibit it.
